title: Jan Niemiec (bishop)
text:
Bishop Jan Niemiec (; ; 14 March 1958 – 27 October 2020) was a Polish-born Ukrainian Roman Catholic prelate, who served as an <a href="Auxiliary%20bishop">Auxiliary bishop</a> of the <a href="Roman%20Catholic%20Diocese%20of%20Kamyanets-Podilskyi">Roman Catholic Diocese of Kamyanets-Podilskyi</a> and the Titular Bishop of <a href="Decoriana">Decoriana</a> since 21 October 2006 until his death on 27 October 2020.
Life.
Bishop Niemiec was born in the Roman-Catholic family of Jan and Maria (née Oparowska) Niemiec in the <a href="Eastern%20Poland">Eastern Poland</a>. After graduation of the school and lyceum education, he subsequently joined the High Pedagogical School in <a href="Rzesz%C3%B3w">Rzeszów</a> (1977–1982) and after – the Major Theological Seminary in <a href="Przemy%C5%9Bl">Przemyśl</a> (1982–1987). He was ordained as <a href="priest">priest</a> on 24 June 1987, after he completed his philosophical and theological study.
After his ordination he served as an assistant parish priest in <a href="Poland">Poland</a> from 1987 until 1992, when he has been transferred to <a href="Ukraine">Ukraine</a>. Also during his parish work he continued to study in the <a href="Catholic%20University%20of%20Lublin">Catholic University of Lublin</a>. Since 1992, Fr. Niemiec is working in the <a href="Roman%20Catholic%20Diocese%20of%20Kamyanets-Podilskyi">Roman Catholic Diocese of Kamyanets-Podilskyi</a> as the professor, prefect (1992–2001) and rector (2001–2007) of the Major Theological Seminary in <a href="Horodok%2C%20Khmelnytskyi%20Oblast">Horodok</a>. Also he graduated the <a href="Institute%20for%20the%20History%20of%20Science%2C%20Polish%20Academy%20of%20Sciences">Institute for the History of Science</a>, an institution of the <a href="Polish%20Academy%20of%20Sciences">Polish Academy of Sciences</a>, with <a href="Doctor%20of%20Science">Doctor of Science</a> degree in 1998.
On 21 October 2006, he was appointed by the <a href="Pope%20Benedict%20XVI">Pope Benedict XVI</a> as the <a href="Auxiliary%20Bishop">Auxiliary Bishop</a> of the <a href="Roman%20Catholic%20Diocese%20of%20Kamyanets-Podilskyi">Roman Catholic Diocese of Kamyanets-Podilskyi</a> and <a href="Titular%20Bishop">Titular Bishop</a> of <a href="Decoriana">Decoriana</a>. On 8 December 2006, he was consecrated as bishop by Cardinal <a href="Marian%20Jaworski">Marian Jaworski</a> and other prelates of the <a href="Roman%20Catholic%20Church">Roman Catholic Church</a> in the <a href="Sts.%20Peter%20and%20Paul%20Cathedral%2C%20Kamianets-Podilskyi">Cathedral of Sts. Peter and Paul</a> in <a href="Kamianets-Podilskyi">Kamianets-Podilskyi</a>.
On 12 April 2007, Bishop Niemiec was appointed as a Vicar General of the same diocese.
Bishop Niemiec died from <a href="COVID-19">COVID-19</a> during the <a href="COVID-19%20pandemic%20in%20Poland">COVID-19 pandemic in Poland</a> on 27 October 2020, at the age of 62, at a hospital in <a href="%C5%81a%C5%84cut">Łańcut</a>, <a href="Poland">Poland</a>, where he was transferred from a hospital in <a href="Kamyanets-Podilskyi">Kamyanets-Podilskyi</a>, <a href="Ukraine">Ukraine</a>, five days earlier.
